body: Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/521/

Question: Would these files need to be copied over if sqgen is needed to be ran after the first install? 

Question 2: Would sqgen ever be needed to run after the first install?
Looks good to me, with some small comments.

@traflm your solution sounds good to me. Could you file a new JIRA to improve how we handle this in the longer term, with your analysis above? Note that we currently allow users to choose the name of the division column, although this syntax is not documented and not recommended.
Test passed , I guess good for merging?
Looks good to me. Is this ready to commit?
Looks good to me. If there are no further comments, I will commit this tomorrow morning (USA time).

I would like to review this, but I have no knowledge about Docker. So I will ask team if there are someone know Docker good.
But I can test it according to your description, do I need to install a docker first? I assume so.

Hi, Amanda,
When a cluster have two nodes " Node1.amanda.com" and "node1.amanda.com", the monitor will fail for sure. It cannot distinguish the two nodes anymore. But that is a very rare case, we'd better ask user not to do that instead of spending time to support this feature, it will be really some coding work :-)

But it will be very helpful to test more, I don't have a real cluster to test this, just use 'hostname something' to unit test it on my dev workstation.

thanks all, TRAFODION-1880 is created to follow up. This commit is a temp/easy solution, and we can work on TRAFODION-1880 to find out a better solution in a longer term.
Please help to merge it if we think this one is ready.
Agree with Hans. In the long term we need to ensure that the NAColumn is created with correct attributes. For now, it should be ok to commit.  I will commit now
I'll create a wiki page describing the steps to setup a docker environment and validate the scripts.
Looks good Hans - thanks. Merging in now.
I had a try on these scripts, but the docker images cannot access internet, so it failed at 'yum install epel-release' step. Is there any setting needed for the docker environment?
Looks good to me, though I am not a Docker or install expert. I checked the license text. I also checked the list of yum packages against the Trafodion wiki.
Looks good to me too. Unless there are objections, I propose we commit this change and address any issues from testing later, given that this is a brand-new feature.
Looks good to me. [DNS names are not case-sensitive](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4343), so "Node1.amanda.com" and "node1.amanda.com" must be one and the same node.

So is the effect of this change that LOB garbage collection is no longer driven by a separate process but instead is done on a piecemeal basis as clients write to LOB columns? Will this have the effect of introducing performance hiccups into transactions involving LOBs?

Dave, there has not been any support for GC prior to this commit.  This is all new. You are right that it will introduce a  hiccup for IUA operations.  what moved out of the mxlobsrvr process is the regular processing of inser/updates/deletes itself. All LOB metadata operations were done in the mxlobsrvr process and all hdfs operations in the master (in a serial manner). There was no need for the process hop in that case. Hence moved that functionality into the master.
Now for GC itself, when have a new Util operator/syntax that can be issued offline, we will consider doing the GC in the mxlobsrvr process. For now it's part of the master. Is that clearer ? This was the way to inttroduce GC without introducing new syntax to do it.
Hi @sandhyasun, yes your explanation makes it clear. The changes look good to me. My code comments are all minor.

Thanks Hans. That was what I needed to know :)

Thanks!

Amanda Moran
jenkins, retest -- ambari did not come up on that test node, hence hbase was not up
Working on a "drop schema" issue that is exposed with these changes. Please do not merge this yet.
Looks good to me. A lot of work!
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/529/
Very nice, another improvement in our build!
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/531/

In case of hbase we have moved away from specifying the server and port and let Hbase Client API get it from hbase-site.xml. It looks like we are introducing the server and port for hive back here,  I couldn't figure out the need for it from the changes. Can you please explain?

The port and server changes done here are simply to use the CQD values which were always there. We are no tintroducing anything new here.The problem was the CQD values were used only in a couple of places. All other places , the port and server were hardcoded to "default" and 0 (zero). SO made changes to remove the hardcoding and use the CQD value in all places. The changes are not for hive access. They are limited tot the places where we are doing LOB data reads and writes.  We use the libhdfsapi in all places to access hdfs here. If there is away to get the port/server from the hbase-site.xml  to pass into the libhdfs API, I will look into that for a future commit.
The reworks look good to me. Is this ready to commit?
Yes - addressed all needed issues for this commit. Thanks !
Are you committing it @sandhyasun or would you like me to?

Did you mean the server or port changes are for hbase access? I was planning to remove these CQDs to avoid confusion and let Hbase API handle it transparently when time permits.  If these are meant for hbase, then these would be cleaned up as part of this effort.
The server and port settings are for LOB hdfs libhdfsAPI access - not Hbase access. So these  two  CQDs LOB_HDFS_PORT and LOB_HDFS_SERVER need to stay for now.
Looks good to me. Without this change, I gather our hash was really only a function of the last byte?

The trafTables in this case seems just a set of trafodion regions with ongoing split/balance (since online split/rebalance is allowed to proceed with concurrent active transactions), not all the trafodion regions. Transactional contexts need to be re-established after the split/balance. The fix will work fine. One minor exception is will we have a set of leftover trafTables zk nodes (/hbase/Trafodion/splitbalance) not been cleaned up after a system crash (the original code will do except it does not handle the hbaseTables == null case).

yes.
